alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Telfair; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 6:47AM EDT until April 09 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Telfair, Dodge and Wilcox Counties. Ocmulgee River near Lumber City affecting Telfair, Montgomery and Wheeler Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Treutlen, Montgomery and Wheeler Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Abbeville, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Mount Vernon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Lumber City. * WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Flood Stage is reached and minor flooding begins. Water overflows into the broad swampy flood plain. Farm fields on the right bank flood. General agriculture and timber interests are affected by the flooding. In addition...water reaches the top of the boat ramp near the Highway 341 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 15 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage to 14.8 feet this morning. It will then rise above flood stage late this morning to 16 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage again Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 15 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 01/06/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
